intro: Cassidocarpus, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Anacardiaceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble showers of golden beads, hence its common name. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, with smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. Its fruits are small, round drupes that turn red when mature, containing a single seed. Cassidocarpus is native to tropical regions of Africa and is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties.
